reviews.review_msg: Gives exams that take 70 minutes to write, with only 50 minutes of exam time. Wonderful.

VERY nice guy, very funny, loves the material.  Unfortunately, he curriculum was way off.  Basically, rather than teaching about ecology, he teaches a bunch of examples, then tests you on those examples.  The principles underlying the examples remain unaddressed.  An easy GPA booster, but don't expect to actually learn much more than trivia.

He is the best prof in the world. There is no one better than him. He is so passionate about what he does and he makes his class so interesting that you do not want the class to end. Love him he is awesome!

I had no interest in ecology, and thought it would be the most boring class. But Dr Gries is a great prof, the class was vvv interesting. only thing i had to study for exam were his notes. he is very nice and extremely helpful. his exams were straight out of notes. i really look forward to take another class with him. i highly recommend him.
He is awesome. He is so passionate about teaching and biology that it's contagious. His videos were spectacular and he is just the best prof ever at SFU. Go to lectures and you'll be fine.

Mr. Gries' lectures were always so interesting! He is so passionate about his field which makes class a pleasure to attend. The tests were all straight out of the notes! Go to lecture, get a good grade!
enjoyed every day. Movies are the key to his wonderfulness!
EXCELLENT PROF!! He is fun & very nice!! Great Class/Be very specific on answers to do well on exams/straight forward exams

Seriously, one of the if not the best prof i've had at sfu. He clearly cares about his students and actually makes coming to class worthwhile. For those of you ever considering taking any of his classes especially 204 TAKE IT!!!!!
funny guy. good stories. lots of movies. gives beer to those who volunteer and tests are straight from the notes. MEMORIZE THE NOTES
No Comments
One of the nicest profs.  He's very helpful and entertaining.
Awesome prof!
Great prof, tough tests
A fantastic lecturer, but beware his exams... they are crazy hard!!!
Gerhard rocks the house. TOTALLY wants you to learn and makes it easy to do so.
Funny, enthusiastic, knowlegeable.
one of the best professors I've ever had...he truly wants you to  understand

Went out of her way to help me with an administrative mix-up so I could actually take the course! Very polite but fair. I enjoyed her lectures. My one complaint is the group assignment toward the end of the course - but that's more an issue with the other students in the course.
Nicole is super funny and nice. The class was pretty easy too but sometimes she goes off on tangents or is really disorganized. Easily flustered but she means well
interesting lecture, easy to study and get along with.

Excellent lecturer. Although each problem set was worth far too much, you will come out the class satisfied with your grade and have a real understanding of the material. TEXTBOOK NOT NEEDED AT ALL!!!!!

Overall, she was a really good prof. Her first midterm was a bit tough, but the second was too easy, and the final was totally 100% fair. She doesn't try to trick you at all - but she wants really specific details. The ta's were a little bit on the picky side, but as an overall course it was really well done.

Overall she is a good lecturer, but isn't the easiest to get a high grade with. Love that she is open to feedback and enthusiastic. She focuses on understanding in exams which makes them harder. Ohh and all her exams were long answer, no multiple choice.

She teaches well but she expect so much from you in exams. She makes her exams hard so that the average remains low.She gives assignment we don't really need. I used to like her. now I just despise her. I just want to be done with her class & never see her again
Bro does not teach
Good prof, not fixated on textbook......keep on top of the material, organize your notes and resources for the uber-time crunched midterms. Final is easier than MT, same length, but double the time.

He is a great prof. Makes the course interesting and entertaining.  The course goes on very fast, about 1 chapter per lecture and finishes off entire book around 2nd midterm.  Open book exam but REALLY hard. There's also presentation.. If you do really hard and prepare it well, you can do good on this course.

Ron is an interesting and captivating professor. He makes fun of the text book, which is entertaining and quick to talk about subjects outside the curriculum. Our midterms were open book, and very hard. Prepare well, and you will do well, its not a hard course.

Dr. Pearson's personality made the class great! She's SUPER knowledgable, loves her work, and delved deep into climate issues w/o repeating the same jargon we hear all the time. She was compassionate and caring. My critique are her exams. All written. She kinda trolled us for the final saying there would be lots of graphs, but not a graph in site
Lectures are a toss-up, sometimes easy to follow sometimes not. Dr. Pearson herself is great.
Audrey is an amazing prof and the lectures are also very clear however, the exams are very tough. The exams were very difficult and a lot of memorization is required in this course.

Dr Pearson is one of the most compassionate and kind professors at SFU. She is so down to earth and always willing to help. You can tell she cares for students! If you take BISC 204, make sure to take it with her, you'll really enjoy the course!

I really liked Professor Palin's class; I think that she explained concepts really well and went a pace that was easy to write notes and to ask questions without missing anything. She was super easy to approach after class to ask questions and was very nice.
I don't get why Mika gets so much hate. He is super sweet, helpful in office hours, and looks out for his students.

Super cool guy that really does care about his students. He gives out practice questions with some of the answers that are of similar format to your exams. His lectures were recorded and super easy to follow both in person and via recording, and seems super passionate about what he teaches. He also brings in his dog, so cute!

Super nice and chill guy. Liked how he put effort into learning everyone's names. Explains questions well during office hours and love that he brings his dog. Exams are ok tho there was lots of writing. Overall, great course with lots of interesting content! Also shout out to Katie the TA for being awesome.

The sweetest prof ever, took time to learn names and was helpful in class and outside. He allows cheat sheets and makes exams very fair. I recommend going to lecture, as his slides sometimes can be vague and has questions he answers in person. The TA was also super helpful
Cool and interesting guy. I felt like he could have given harder tests and assignments for what he taught us, which I mean. Still a problem, not a bad problem to have

David was a very kind professor, that took the time to remember everyone's name, and he always took the time to answer questions from the class during lectures. He also was eager to help during office hours. My only complaint is that I attended every office hour and still am not too sure how to improve my answers to his questions on exams and such.

David is an extremely helpful prof who tries to make sure that every student will succeed in his course. Puts in effort to remember everybody's name in the class. Some lectures are a bit dry, but that's more of the content and less his teaching style

I liked that Davids lectures were short and easy to digest, and I enjoyed the content. However, the grading was a bit nit picky and feedback on the limited practice problems wasnt easily accessible unless you went for office hours. I feel like the tutorial time couldve been used better to go over the worksheets that were given out for practice.

Funny Brit. He sounded monotonous in the first lecture and I thought 'this is going to be so boring'. But the rest of the semester was actually very enjoyable and he gets to know each of his students really well. Takes his time explaining lectures and he does group activities in class which are really fun! Lots of writing in his exams but are fair!

Really thorough knowledge of ecology, and takes lots of time to answer questions. Gives lots of examples to help facilitate memorizing. Lots of content but she makes in manageable! Definitely attend lectures if you want clarity on all the topics.

The entire course was graded on 1 final exam and a group project. She gives every exam question on the first day so you can just memorize it all and not have to go to a single lecture. Maybe not the best if you want to actually learn the material but good gpa boost.

Surprisingly, absolutely none of the lecture content was required for this course. I'm not saying this as hyperbole, you could technically have done well in this class without attending a single lecture, one of my friends got an A- and didn't attend a single lecture past the first. Grading schemes are completely withheld for whatever reason.

I made it through the class just by attending the tutorials. never made it to the lecture or even opened the textbook. the easiest class I've taken! show up to tutorials and you'll get nothing less than a B. a little effort and yay you got an A

This class was based on a presentation, oral exam, and an essay (each worth 30%). So I was able to get through this course without attending the lectures or even using my textbook. Prof was nice, but was very unclear with her expectations/gradings. More communication would have been great. TA's were the only reason why I was able to do well!

I thought Dr. Bendell was a great professor for the course, I found it very interesting. The course grade is based on an essay, group presentation, tutorial participation, and an oral exam. All of which are spread out so you don't feel overwhelmed. Dr. Bendell herself seems very passionate in her area so it makes the course more enjoyable.

Goes through lectures extremely quickly and leaves a lot out of her slides, making it difficult to catch everything she talks about. However, the topics are generally not too complicated and 60% of the grade is based on an essay and presentation that do not have to relate to lecture. She seems kind and likes to interact with students.

60% of your grade is an ecology essay, that doesn't relate to the lectures, and a group powerpoint presentation, that also barely relates to the lectures. Her lecture slides have no words and are incredibly vague for when you DO need them for your oral exam, not that her explaining them improves understanding because she is also vague when teaching

I was shocked by the 2 no cumulative midterms + no final.  Grades are easily obtained by participation and easy assignments. Although the lectures notes are unclear and she speaks fast, it was pretty easy to grasp the concept after discussing with classmates.
As long as you follow her criteria in assignment and study the notes you jot down in the class you will get good grade.

Although she is a kind lady, she is not capable to teach for multiple reasons (not all are covered). Terribly disorganized, Notes are almost completely useless, Speaks super fast, Jumps from topic to topic without connection, wastes a lot of time, marking is unpredictable, teaches like the content is just review, makes tonnes of errors EVERYWHERE!

Excellent Professor! She really emphasized the key concept that she wanted her students to understand and apply. She does not force memory but the general concepts and ideas which will be able to be of use in a practical setting. We were able to go out and do some lab field work which was great! PEarth videos brought everything into perspective.
Best course of my UG degree
Great class, great prof.

I am a fourth year student and left BISC204 for my final year. It was the best course of my whole undergraduate. Dr. Bendell taught ecology using lectures, field assignments and DVDs. It was great and I highly recommend this course to others.
Leah was an awesome  prof. uses the outdoors to teach ecology
Her lectures are super vague. She talks too fast. Lecture notes are disorganized, so you won't learn much from them. She is a caring and nice person, just not a good lecturer.

terrible prof. her notes are useless and extremely vague, and she doesn't do any better elaborating on them in class. she only puts 5 questions on the 3 exams she gives, and all of them are scattered and disorganized.
Terrible lectures and notes, unable to convey material effectively, and exams were unfair.
Simply an excellent teacher, able to convey complex concepts in a clear and fun way.
I had Leah twice and thought she was great.  It was so refreshing to take a biology class that wasn't entirely about memorization.  She cared more about big ideas than little details.
Very good proffessor articulates very clearly, and makes class interesting. Very intersted in the material she teaches.
No Comments

Her notes are useless...you have to search through the notes to find the useful info.  The TAs are amazing...learned way more from them then from this prof.  Read the textbook and go to tutorials and you should do fine though.
Not good. Sux. I don't like her teaching style. Hard to understand in that way.

Incredibly sporadic notes, no online recording of lectures. Subjective marking, She expects you to be able to integrate every major concept clearly and concisely even though her notes are completely worthless. Be prepared to do LOTS of self teaching, and go to EVERY class. Overall, I have never seen a science course been taught this way.
She's nice, but her teaching style ... and notes ... are a little strange.  If it wasn't for her TAs (tutorials were helpful), this class could be a potential disaster.

Fun in Class and really knows her stuff.  Willing to change her lectures in order to address questions students have about or relating to the material.  Finds creative ways to introduce hard/boring material. Wants very specific exam answers, but most questions have to do with concepts.
Notes are mostly in keywords or point form. Not very clear. Very rush in the materials. Try to avoid if you can.
Although I did very well on this course, I noticed she played favorites. Don't take this course if she happens to be teaching it.

I appreciate how she gives us final exam Q to work on at home before the last midterm. But I don't like the lectures without giving any notes for us to print or recordings for us to review the lectures.

Mixed opinion.  Nice person, tries to explain the "big picture" but doesn't quite work.  Exam questions very vague but answers specific.  Would have done much worse if the TAs didn't give hints or if she didn't give us practice Qs.  No notes, no recordings just talks general concepts.  Bad textbook.
VERY VERY poor teacher. Her lectures are uninformative and boring. DO NOT take this course with this teacher.
I really love ecology and she seems to as well... Only she seems to hate men and she has a really arrogant attitude. Not pleasant to talk with :( Take this course with Dr. Gries!!!
Super approachable. Told us what the questions were going to be on the final! Not as much math as other ecology profs. (And she does omit your worst midterm even if she says shes not going to).

The exams cover the general knowledge of the course rather than specifics.  People who like straight memorization rather than processes won't like her.  Lectures are really interesting, and she's great to talk to outside of class.
